column4: anybody installed vmware workstation demo 6 on their machine?
yes but there are many options for virtualisation
k, like?
virtualbox is okay, qemu , xen , vmware and kvm are others
is xen any good? i.e. can it provide a usual winxp system?
xen requires a cpu that supports hardware virtualisation to handle winxp i believe, but i use virtualbox for xp and it works great (at least for me)
so, no 64-bit ubuntu for virtualbox then? :(
just seen in the faq
indeed at the time being
in the faq it says as of 1.4.0 it does
you there?
and many others yep

just been reading this (https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WindowsXPUnderQemuHowTo) and it states a note to 64-bit users, do they mean people who want to install a 64-bit OS on qemu or people who are using 64-bit ubuntu?
same for me, im currently using vmware for 64bit hosts
that is for people who have a 64bit installation, which qemu is installed to
right, that doesn't seem to make sense though as this is an emulation??
if you installed 64bit ubuntu, you would use qemu-system-x86_64 command :)
yeah, I'm on 64-bit ubuntu
how can I tell (if at all) if qemu is using the kernel module?
it will become apparant when you run an install :)
on a new faster machine, so not sure ;)
it should say something like Could not open '/dev/kqemu' - QEMU acceleration layer not activated if its not loaded or you aren't in the correct group
k, must be working then
the copying of files is taking it's time...
